resource.name: Crime Responses
resource.description:
Disclaimer:
Crime Responses is provided by the Gainesville Police Department (GPD) to document initial details surrounding an incident to which GPD officers respond. This dataset contains crime incidents from 2011 to present and includes a reduced set of fields focused on capturing the type of incident as well when and where an incident occurred.
The Incident location addresses have been rounded off and are not the exact location due to the constitutional amendment known as "Marsy's Law".

In 2021, Florida reporting of crime data began a transition from Summary Reporting System (SRS) to National Incident-Based Reporting System (NIBRS), causing an effect on crime statistics reported by Law Enforcement Agencies such as the Gainesville Police Department who made this transition on November 16, 2021.  The effect would be an increase in crime due to the elimination of the SRS Hierarchy Rule which collected only the most serious offense in an incident while NIBRS will now capture up to 10 offenses per incident and specifies more offense categories than SRS.  The inclusion of these crimes, particularly property crimes, will reflect an increase in crime when switching from SRS reporting to NIBRS' reporting.  The apparent increase (usually not greater than 2.7%) is simply due to the difference between how crimes are counted in NIBRS versus the SRS and its application of the Hierarchy Rule.  More information regarding NIBRS effect on crime statistics can be found on the following link:  https://ucr.fbi.gov/nibrs/2014/resource-pages/effects_of_nibrs_on_crime_statistics_final.pdf.
columns_description: Hour of the day when the offense was reported.
Hour of day when the offense took place.
Day of the week when the offense was reported.
Longitude of the street block where the offense took place.
Location of the offense approximated to street block.
Type of incident that occured.
Incident identification number.
Latitude of the street block where the offense took place.
City where the incident occurred.
Geo-coded point of the street block where the offense took place.
State where the incident occurred.
Day of the week when the offense took place.
Date and time that the incident report was filed.
Date and time of the offense.

resource.name: 311 Service Requests (myGNV)
resource.description:
Non-emergency requests like pothole repairs or damaged street signs can be reported through the Web: www.myGNV.org or app.

iPhone Users: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/mygnv/id1011272233
Android Users: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.citysourced.gainesvillefl
or online (http://www.cityofgainesville.org/openGNV/311GNV.aspx).
***Disclaimer: The data reflected on this page is through 06/18/2021. We have updated our MyGNV app. We are working to get the data uploaded from the new platform. We appreciate your patience
columns_description: The date and time the service request was made

Status of the request. 
OPEN:  The request has been sent
ACKNOWLEDGED: Staff has acknowledged that the request has been opened.
CLOSED: The service request has either been made into a work order to fix the problem or the request has been resolved with the requester. 
REOPENED: The request has been reopened by the requester for further investigation
The unique identification number for each open service request
If the issue was reported through a mobile device
The chosen display name for those reporting. May be a user name (logged in an using their user name to report), anonymous (logged in but choosing to stay anonymous) or guest (not signed in)
The address of the issue (manually input by the requester)
Detailed description of the service request
The amount of time (in minutes) to resolve the  request with a message through the online 311 system
The department or office the request has been assigned to
The amount of time (in minutes) to acknowledge the open request with a message through the online 311 system
The date and time of when the service request was "closed" by staff. This reflects whether the request was moved into a work order to solve the issue or if the ticket was resolved with the requester
The date and time of when the service request was reopened by the requester
The date and time of when the service request was acknowledged by staff through the online 311 system
The date and time of the last update made to the service request

resource.name: Annexation Activity
resource.description: Annexation is when unincorporated property becomes incorporated into the city. This data set contains annexation activity beginning in 1985 to present. Explore the data lens associated with this data set to experience this data through different visualizations.
columns_description: If the annexation type was referendum, this is the amount of votes in favor of the annexation.
Year that the annexation became effective.
If the annexation was successful.
Whether the property was developed or undeveloped at the time of annexation.
If the annexation type was referendum, this is the amount of votes not in favor of the annexation.
If the annexation was successful, this is the date that it officially became part of Gainesville.

resource.name: Asset Inventory
resource.description:
This dataset is an inventory of the assets on the site. Here you can track the performance of data publishing, metadata maintenance, as well as present an overview of what data exists on the site.

Note: This is only updated once per day.
columns_description: The name of the currently published version of this dataset
The uid of the currently published version of this dataset

Has four possible values:

* Unpublished: Does not show up in catalog. Waiting to be published.
* Published: The authoritative and broadly available current copy of a dataset
* Snapshotted: An older copy of the dataset which has been saved for reference
* Copying: A dataset which is in the process of being copied internally. This is an ephemeral state.
contact email for the dataset listed in private metadata
Dataset Owner Name
Last update of tabular data only, will not reflect metadata or shapefiles
if data is federated, the source domain will populate here
if the row represents a view/map/data_lens page etc. the underlying parent dataset UID populates
Public or Private
if the row represents a view/map/data_lens page etc. that is derived from another dataset = True

resource.name: Arrests
resource.description:
This dataset reflects arrests in the City of Gainesville since 2011. Arrest data is provided by the Gainesville Police Department (GPD) and derived from Police reports.

Disclaimer:
Crime Responses is provided by the Gainesville Police Department (GPD) to document initial details surrounding an incident to which GPD officers respond. This dataset contains crime incidents from 2011 to present and includes a reduced set of fields focused on capturing the type of incident as well when and where an incident occurred.
The Incident location addresses have been rounded off and are not the exact location due to the constitutional amendment known as "Marsy's Law".

In 2021, Florida reporting of crime data began a transition from Summary Reporting System (SRS) to National Incident-Based Reporting System (NIBRS), causing an effect on crime statistics reported by Law Enforcement Agencies such as the Gainesville Police Department who made this transition on November 16, 2021. The effect would be an increase in crime due to the elimination of the SRS Hierarchy Rule which collected only the most serious offense in an incident while NIBRS will now capture up to 10 offenses per incident and specifies more offense categories than SRS. The inclusion of these crimes, particularly property crimes, will reflect an increase in crime when switching from SRS reporting to NIBRS' reporting. The apparent increase (usually not greater than 2.7%) is simply due to the difference between how crimes are counted in NIBRS versus the SRS and its application of the Hierarchy Rule. More information regarding NIBRS effect on crime statistics can be found on the following link: https://ucr.fbi.gov/nibrs/2014/resource-pages/effects_of_nibrs_on_crime_statistics_final.pdf.
columns_description: Description of the charge the invidual was arrested for. This is defined by Gainesville Police Department
Sex of the individual arrested
Race of the individual arrested. This is pulled from the Department of Motor Vehicle and subject to visual and self identification
Name ID of the individual arrested
Case number for the Arrest
Date of Arrest
Age of the individual arrested
Day of week of Arrest
Charge the invidual was arrested for

resource.name: Traffic Crashes
resource.description:
This dataset shows information about each traffic crash since 2011 on city streets within the City of Gainesville limits and under the jurisdiction of Gainesville Police Department (GPD). 
Data shown are more than 60 days from when accidents occurred due to Florida Statutes 316.066.

Disclaimer:
In 2021, Florida reporting of crime data began a transition from Summary Reporting System (SRS) to National Incident-Based Reporting System (NIBRS), causing an effect on crime statistics reported by Law Enforcement Agencies such as the Gainesville Police Department who made this transition on November 16, 2021.  The effect would be an increase in crime due to the elimination of the SRS Hierarchy Rule which collected only the most serious offense in an incident while NIBRS will now capture up to 10 offenses per incident and specifies more offense categories than SRS.  The inclusion of these crimes, particularly property crimes, will reflect an increase in crime when switching from SRS reporting to NIBRS' reporting.  The apparent increase (usually not greater than 2.7%) is simply due to the difference between how crimes are counted in NIBRS versus the SRS and its application of the Hierarchy Rule.  More information regarding NIBRS effect on crime statistics can be found on the following link:  https://ucr.fbi.gov/nibrs/2014/resource-pages/effects_of_nibrs_on_crime_statistics_final.pdf.
columns_description: Number of people involved in the crash

The accident location, as determined by reporting officer, as derived from the reported address of crash, in a column type that allows for mapping and other geographic analysis in the data portal software

Number of pedestrians involved in the crash

resource.name: City of Gainesville Parking Lots
resource.description: The downtown Gainesville area provides free time limited parking as well as metered and long term parking. Parcel number associated with the building permit.

Address where permit was issued
Reason or classification for receiving building permit.
Contractor
Business conducting modifications to the property.
Primary party responsible for the property.

resource.name: Community Grant Program
resource.description: Local organizations receiving assistance from the Community Grant Program for FYs2011-2013 (October 2010 through September 2013).

resource.name: RTS Ridership - by route, by month
resource.description: Regional Transit System (RTS) Ridership data, by route, by month.
columns_description: Year of the ridership month.
Month of ridership.
Fiscal year of the ridership month. Fiscal year for the City of Gainesville runs from October to September.
The route ID number is displayed on front of buses and at bus stops.
Total passengers that boarded the route during the month.
The route name depicts the start and end points of the route.
Last day of the ridership month.

resource.name: Fire/Rescue Responses
resource.description: Fire / EMS response data for FY2012 up to the most current month available.
columns_description: Name of location if the response was to a general area, building, or business.
Type of response to call-for-service, including EMS (emergency medical services), ALM (alarm), Fire, and SVC (other general services).
Name and type of GFR unit responding to call, including E (engines), Q (quints), SQ (squads), and T (towers).
Unique number describing the response.
Date and time GFR responds to a call for service.

resource.name: Open Data Resources
resource.description: Website and links to resources and organizations dedicated to the open data movement.

resource.name: Code Complaints, Violations & Permits
resource.description:
The Code Enforcement Division enforces:

- Housing and Commercial Building Codes (Chapter 13)
- Rental Housing Permits (Chapter 14.5)
- Nuisance Codes (Chapter 16)
- Abandoned Vehicles on private property (Chapter 26)
- Land Development Code (Chapter 30)
- Graffiti (Chapter 13)
This report lists, code complaints, violations and permits. 
Data is updated monthly and dates back to  February 2011.
Please note that addresses that are listed under the Location field as 0 W 1ST ST are null place-holders and are not accurate addresses.
columns_description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset '2010 Census Tracts' (e6r8-dw75) the point in column 'geocode' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'City Commission Districts' (4x5c-ywwx) the point in column 'geocode' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.
Current status of response to complaint received.
Description of case per the complaint received or violation identified.
Address of the complaint or violation.
Date when violation identified or investigation occurred.

resource.name: Small Businesses Directory Vendors
resource.description: A list of vendors participating in our small, minority, and service-disabled veterans business procurement program.
columns_description: Type of SBD business
Legal name of vendor

resource.name: Gainesville Police Zones
resource.description: Gainesville Police department has 2 districts and each districts is divided up in 6 zones.

resource.name: RTS Diesel Consumption
resource.description: This data shows how much diesel is consumed by the busses of the Regional Transit System, how much it cost to purchase, and how many hours the busses traveled.
columns_description: note that purchases are not necessarily officiated at the end of the month, rather this column is here to help set up visualizations on this site

resource.name: Landlord Permits
resource.description: Permits paid by and issued to single family residential property owners who do not have homestead exemption.

resource.name: Utility Consumption - City Facilities & Properties
resource.description: Electric, water, and gas utility consumption for the City of Gainesville owned facilities and properties for fiscal years 2012-present.
columns_description: Owner of the service address.
Electric, Gas, Water, Wastewater or Reclaimed Water.
Last day of the month of consumption.
Address receiving utility services.
Amount of utility consumption. Gal for gas, KGal for water, wastewater and reclaimed water, or KWh for electric.
Longitude of geocoded service address.
Latitude of geocoded address.
Geocoded address.
